Comment: Fighting the Sicialian is awkward business. I prefer 2. f4, the Grand Prix, or 2. Ne2 (Keres System), above 2. Nf3... So does my opponent: he prefers a quick 2. d4, and get it over with... Get to d5, or die...

Fighting the Sicialian is awkward business. I prefer 2. f4, the Grand Prix, or 2. Ne2 (Keres System), above 2. Nf3... So does my opponent: he prefers a quick 2. d4, and get it over with... Get to d5, or die...

I am not the type of player, that will defend c5, via d6, or even e6. That will lose tempo along the way. The main object for black, is to control d5... Most of the times, I prefer 2. ... g6 here, with quick Dragon tendencies... In the event of 3. dxc5, Qa5+, followed by Qxc5 at some point... Eventually cxd4 gets forced, so I decided to call whites bluff...
3. Qxd4 Nc6 4. Qa4 Nf6, promises white nothing... But this is too slow...
Of course! After 4. Nxe5? Qa5+...
4. Bc4 Qc7, is no good... This is probably best...
Surely, white had to play 5. cxd4 exd4 first, before even considering Bc4. After 6. Nxd4 Bb4+ 7. Nc3 Nf6...
